folder: Castleton Avenue & Bard Avenue, Staten Island, NY
text:
Castleton Avenue, north side, from Bard to Kissel Avenues, showing the old building of St. Vincents Hospital. It was at one time (1874 map) the W. T. Garner mansion and later (1898 map) the St. Austin Protestant
Episcopal School for Boys.
About 1910
By Mulford Simonson
From P. M. Sperr Collection
(2)
The same, years later.
May 1, 1931
P. L. Sperr
(3)
An additional view.
October 26, 1931
P. L. Sperr

folder: Bard Avenue & Castleton Avenue, Staten Island, NY
text:
443 Bard Ave., east side, between Castleton and Delafield Aves. (at the head of Dekay Street), showing the residence of Dr. Charles
Stiles.
1925.
P. L. Sperr.

folder: Castleton Avenue & Bard Avenue, Staten Island, NY
text:
(1)
Castleton Avenue, north side, from Bard to Kissel Avenues, showing the old building of St. Vincents Hospital. It was at one time (1874) the W. T. Garner Mansion and later (1898) the
Protestant Episcopal School for Boys.
February 12. 1930
P. L. Sperr
(2)
The new 6-story building of St. Vincents Hospital, at the N.E. corner of Bard and Castleton Avenues.
October 26, 1931
P. L. Sperr
(3)
The hospital gate on Bard Avenue.
July 5, 1932
P. L. Sperr
